channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Coronavirus: US death toll passes 50,000 in world's deadliest outbreak
item.description: A grim milestone is passed by the world's deadliest outbreak, although US mortality rate is comparatively low.

item.title: Coronavirus test website reopens for bookings after 'significant demand'
item.description: Millions of key workers and their households can apply for a test to see if they have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Twin sisters Katy and Emma Davis die with Covid-19
item.description: Nurse Katy Davis and her twin Emma died just days apart at the same hospital, their sister says.

item.title: Captain Tom tops the charts at the age of 99
item.description: The war veteran, who walked laps of his garden for the NHS, is the oldest person to hit number one.

item.title: Coronavirus: China rejects call for probe into origins of disease
item.description: Beijing's deputy ambassador to the UK tells the BBC the demands are politically motivated.

item.title: Dyson Covid-19 ventilators are 'no longer required'
item.description: Firm's founder says demand is less than envisioned but the government says tests are ongoing.

item.title: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa mocked over face mask struggles
item.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa has problems putting on a mask after urging South Africans to wear them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Eddie Large funeral held in Bristol
item.description: Syd Little pays tribute to his comedy partner and "best friend" Eddie Large at a ceremony in Bristol.

item.title: Coronavirus: Volunteers 'not being called upon' to help NHS
item.description: Organisers of the NHS Volunteer Responder Scheme say it has taken longer than expected to set up.

item.title: Coronavirus: Paralysed Ed Jackson reaches Everest staircase feat
item.description: Former rugby player Ed Jackson has climbed 89,056 steps and made 2,783 trips up and down the stairs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Library books rearranged in size order by cleaner
item.description: The well-meaning cleaner gave librarians a giggle when they discovered the neatly rearranged tomes.

item.title: Meghan letter published by Mail to 'satisfy curiosity'
item.description: The duchess is suing the Mail on Sunday and MailOnline for reproducing parts of a letter to her father.

item.title: Hubble telescope delivers stunning 30th birthday picture
item.description: The veteran telescope celebrates three decades in orbit with a colourful image of star formation.

item.title: ‘Like a clenched fist’ – how artists are depicting the lockdown
item.description: British sculptor Sir Antony Gormley is among the artists sharing work from home during the health crisis.

item.title: Shakespeare Day 2020: Dame Judi Dench reads from Richard II
item.description: To mark Shakespeare Day 2020, some of Britain’s most famous Shakespearean actors read an excerpt of Richard II.

item.title: Coronavirus: Drones to deliver NHS supplies to Isle of Wight
item.description: A delivery drone trial between Hampshire and the Isle of Wight has been brought forward.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: Big Night In: 11 highlights from BBC's £27m fundraiser
item.description: Prince William, Doctor Who and Miranda joined comedians and musicians on the TV fundraising special.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: On satellites and stars Together at Home
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Prickles the sheep found after seven years of Tasmania self-isolation
item.description: A sheep that went missing in the Tasmanian bush has been found seven years later.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I can't wash my hands - my water was cut off'
item.description: In the midst of a public health crisis, low-income families in Detroit have had their water cut off.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump’s disinfectant and sunlight claims fact-checked
item.description: The US president's latest comments about virus treatments have caused an outcry among medical experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wages, sick pay and time off explained
item.description: As many people see smaller pay cheques, we explain wages and sick pay during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: My Money: 'The alcohol bill has increased, but he's earned it!'
item.description: As part of a BBC blog series, Claire Millington in the UK talks us through one week during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Ramadan: Fasting safely during coronavirus crisis
item.description: During Ramadan, many Muslim people abstain from eating and drinking between sunrise and sunset.

item.title: Coronavirus: Influencers' glossy lifestyles lose their shine
item.description: Advertisers are cancelling contracts with influencers who can’t travel to create content in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I faked having Covid-19 on Facebook and got arrested'
item.description: Across the world police are chasing down alleged symptom-fakers who are being accused of triggering panic.

item.title: 10 songs supporting the world through lockdown
item.description: DJs around the world reveal the songs helping their listeners keep upbeat while stuck at home.

item.title: With humans vulnerable: How about a digital helper?
item.description: Robots and digital assistants have proved useful during the Covid-19 pandemic but are still limited.

item.title: No title winners, no relegation - Dutch top flight abandoned for season
item.description: The top tier of football in the Netherlands is cancelled because of the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: ECB receives 'multiple offers' to host games abroad
item.description: The England and Wales Cricket Board has received "multiple offers" from other countries to help complete the domestic season.

item.title: City council to investigate Liverpool v Atletico impact on coronavirus
item.description: Liverpool City Council will investigate whether the staging of a Champions League fixture had any impact on the spread of coronavirus in the city.

item.title: Government urged not to 'sit on the bench' in Newcastle takeover
item.description: The government is urged to "take a role" and "not sit on the bench" in the potential £300m takeover of Newcastle United by a Saudi-backed consortium.

item.title: Rugby player fined and banned after signing for two clubs
item.description: Rohan Janse van Rensburg is fined and given a two-week ban for signing contracts with both Sale and Gloucester.

item.title: World Cup Rewind - watch England's 2018 last-16 win over Colombia
item.description: Penalty joy, Kane's golden touch and some dark arts. Relive England's World Cup 2018 win over Colombia on Sunday on the BBC.

item.title: Rangers push for fresh vote inquiry as they call for general meeting of SPFL clubs
item.description: Rangers - "alongside other clubs" - request a general meeting of all 42 SPFL sides to consider calling an independent inquiry into the league's ballot on ending the lower-league season.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should we all be wearing face masks now?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus: How close is the UK to 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus – explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to wash your hands - in 20 seconds
item.description: Dr Adele McCormick from the University of Westminster demonstrates how to wash your hands.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: More myths to ignore
item.description: Reality Check tackles misleading health advice being shared online.

item.title: The workers braving coronavirus
item.description: From supermarkets to warehouses to pharmacies, these are the people keeping things running.

item.title: The volunteer army helping self-isolating neighbours
item.description: The coronavirus outbreak has left many feeling trapped indoors, but for some help may not be far away.

item.title: Coronavirus: The rough sleepers who can't self-isolate
item.description: With soup kitchens closing and hostels 'like a Petri dish', homeless people are scared about the future.

item.title: Eliud Kipchoge: The humble home life in rural Kenya behind remarkable athletic success
item.description: Witnessing Eliud Kipchoge's humble home life in rural Kenya sheds light on some of the secrets behind his remarkable athletic success.

item.title: Afghanistan: The detention centre for teenage Taliban members
item.description: The Afghan detention centre houses some 300 boys under 18, of whom half are alleged to be militants.
